mcqs.question: How is the receiver operating curve (ROC) represented for a classifier?

options.A: By plotting the diagonal elements of a confusion matrix
options.B: By plotting the area under the curve for different threshold values
options.C: By plotting true positive rate vs. false positive rate
options.E: By plotting false negatives against true negatives

mcqs.question: Consider a confusion matrix as defined in the lecture material. What does the sum of its single row indicate?

options.B: Number of samples that belong to a certain class
options.D: Number of samples recognized to belong to a class

mcqs.question: What is the purpose of negative samples in object detection?

options.A: To represent the object of interest
options.B: To evaluate the performance of the detector
options.C: To normalize the feature values between 0 and 1
options.E: To train the classifier to differentiate objects

mcqs.question: What is the essential difference between object detection and image categorization?

options.A: Image categorization processes regions, while object detection processes entire images
options.B: Object detection locates and identifies objects, while image categorization assigns a single label to the entire image
options.C: Object detection finds a single instance, while image categorization finds multiple instances
options.D: Image categorization works with precise object locations, while object detection ignores spatial information
options.E: Object detection uses global features, while image categorization relies on local descriptors

What is an obvious bottleneck of the nearest neighbor classifier?

options.A: It can only handle binary problems
options.E: It requires a large amount of training data

mcqs.question: What assumption is made when using k-means for color image segmentation?

options.A: Neighboring pixels share the same label
options.B: Colors are distinct and separable in RGB-space
options.C: The color values are uniformly distributed
options.D: Colors form overlapping clusters in RGB-space
options.E: Each color in the image has a unique label

mcqs.question: What is the benefit of unsupervised learning compared to supervised learning?

options.A: It does not require labeling of training data
options.B: It recognizes specific classes of interest

mcqs.question: What is assumed about the classification problem when using the nearest centroid classifier?

options.E: Class centers are evenly distributed in the feature space

mcqs.question: Why is visual bag of words good for image categorization but not good for object detection?

options.D: It is not invariant to spatial transformations
